name: benzoic acid, 2-hydroxy-, 2-hydroxyethyl ester
Reason: Benzoic acid itself has a melting point of 5.5 degrees Celsius. The presence of a hydroxyl group in the base molecule can increase the melting point due to increased intermolecular hydrogen bonding. The ethyl ester group can contribute to the melting point due to increased molecular weight and steric hindrance.
